activities.loc: Calumet County Courthouse, West Entrance, Room 121

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Perry J. Zaidel

SPD will appoint counsel,
Waives reading of complaint,
Preliminary Hearing requested - time limits waived.

940.02(2)(a) - 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs

Shall not possess or consume any controlled substance or paraphernalia, including syringes, without a valid prescription.
Shall not leave state of Wisconsin without permission of the Court.
Shall not have contact with victim's family.  No contact means no contact in person, in writing, by phone, computer, through a third person or otherwise, except through the defendant's attorney.
Shall not apply for a passport while case is pending.
Shall not have contact with any known drug users or dealers except in a treatment type setting.

Defendant refused to be seen per jail,
Probable Cause found by Court,
$25,000 Cash Bond ordered.
